sen.j: 滋野井家（しげのいけ）は、羽林家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: Shigenoi family was a kuge (court noble) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
Shigenoi family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
Shigenoi family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).

sen.j: 藤原北家閑院家三条流（藤原公季流）。
sen.e: Kanin family Sanjo line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan (FUJIWARA no Kinsuke line)
The Kanin family Sanjo line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan (FUJIWARA no Kinsuke line)
The Kanin family Sanjo line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan (FUJIWARA no Kinsue line)
Family business was kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines).
Their Family business was kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines).
Their Family business was kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 180 koku (approx. 33.1cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 180 koku (approx. 33.1cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 180 koku (approx. 33.1cubic meters).

sen.j: 平安時代末期、藤原公教（三条公教）の二男滋野井実国から始まる。
sen.e: The family line began with Sanekuni SHIGENOI, who was the second son of FUJIWARA no Kinnori (SANJO Kinnori), in the last days of the Heian Period.
The family line began with Sanekuni SHIGENOI, who was the second son of FUJIWARA no Kinnori (SANJO Kinnori), during the last days of the Heian Period.
The family line began with Sanekuni SHIGENOI, who was the second son of FUJIWARA no Kinnori (Kinnori SANJO), during the last days of the Heian Period.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、滋野井公澄・滋野井実全・滋野井公麗と3代にわたって有職故実の大家を輩出する。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, three leading figures of yusoku kojitsu (studies in ancient court and military practices and usages) in successive generations, Kinzumi SHIGENOI, Sanemasa SHIGENOI and Kinkazu SHIGENOI, were produced.

During the Edo Period, three leading figures of yusoku kojitsu (studies in ancient court and military practices and usages) in successive generations, Kinzumi SHIGENOI, Sanemasa SHIGENOI and Kinkazu SHIGENOI, were produced.

During the Edo Period, three leading figures of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) in successive generations, Kinzumi SHIGENOI, Sanemasa SHIGENOI and Kinkazu SHIGENOI, were produced.
sen.cmt: Sanemasa の前のスペース短縮有職故実の定訳

sen.j: 明治維新後、滋野井公寿（きんひさ）の時に伯爵位を賜る。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the peerage of count was conferred on the family at the generation of Kinhisa SHIGENOI.
After Meiji Restoration, the peerage of count was conferred on the family during the generation of Kinhisa SHIGENOI.
After the Meiji Restoration, the peerage of count was conferred on the family during the generation of Kinhisa SHIGENOI.

sen.j: 公寿は甲府県知事を務めたが、大正2年1月爵位を返上した。
sen.e: Kinhisa worked as the Governor of Kofu Prefecture, but returned the peerage in January 1913.
Kinhisa worked as the Governor of Kofu Prefecture, but returned to the peerage in January 1913.
